items.sentence: I think that you should walk your dog at least thirty minutes a day.
I can't go to the party, but thank you for inviting me all the same.
Tom went up to Mary at the party and told her he had a crush on her.
The man that I met in the park yesterday said that his name was Tom.
I don't think that Tom is going to go to Boston with Mary next week.
We'll do everything we can to ensure that this doesn't happen again.
As soon as you've done that, I'd like you to start preparing supper.
More than 70 percent of the inhabitants are in favor of the program.
In the winter, I like to sled down the small hill close to our home.
I caught a cold. That's why I couldn't attend the meeting yesterday.
The sky grew darker and darker, and the wind blew harder and harder.
Make sure that the complaints are dealt with as quickly as possible.
The rain prevented the boys from playing baseball on the playground.
Many high school students hang around at book stores reading comics.
There is more moorland in Northern Germany than in Southern Germany.
My name cannot be pronounced by Earthlings, but you may call me Tom.
If there's no bread for the poor, there'll be no peace for the rich.
Tom told me that he first met Mary in Boston when he was a teenager.
I think that Tom should tell Mary that he can't really speak French.
I think it would be a good idea for you to go to Australia with Tom.
